name: Novotel Edinburgh Park

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night with my partner and 5 yr old niece and was impressed with every aspect of the stay.
reviews.title: Comfortable and good value
Fab hotel, location perfect
reviews.text: Room was a generous size even with the sofa bed pulled out for my niece. Bathroom was clean and shower was lovely. We ate both dinner and breakfast at the hotel and again had no complaints. Refresh, hot, tasty food and plenty variety available at breakfast. Pool was quite small, but my niece still enjoyed herself in it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely a hotel I will consider again when back in Edinburgh
reviews.title: Does the job

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my husband and son so we could go to the lion king in the city. Location was perfect. Parked the car up and the train station was only a two minute walk way. 10 on train and we were in the heart of the city centre at a cost of £6 return between us ( less than parking charges). Hotel was simple but had a modern feel to it. Rooms clean and comfortable. Pool was small but excellent . Had breakfast in the hotel but there is a tesco and krispie creme nearby. Staff very helpful. Would certainly stay again for future visits to edinburgh .
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel.

reviews.text: Was looking for a decent hotel to stay a few nights over New Year's, one with a free car park and easy access to Edinburgh centre for the Hogmanay. Note to new visitors, you need to use a different postcode as our Satnav took us down a business park with a barrier-gate outside the hotel, but the security wouldn't let us through.
reviews.title: Bad stay

description: The 4 star Novotel Edinburgh Park is ideally located for a city break in Edinburgh, the hotel has free on site parking, leisure facilities including a pool, gym and steam room. The hotels is only a 2 minute walk to Edinburgh Park train station, where the frequent trains take you into the heart of the city in 7 minutes, kids travel free at weekends. Elements Restaurant is the place to eat, after a busy day sightseeing, serving quality food and drink in relaxed surroundings.
